column1: 110. (1)  A market intermediary shall, to the extent that it receives money or other assets from or on account of a client–

column2: (a)  do so on the basis that the money or other assets shall be applied solely for such purpose as may be agreed to by
the client when or before it receives the money or other assets;
shall hold money and other assets received on account of a client in trust for the benefit of such client;
(c)   shall not commingle money received on account of a client with its own funds or use such money as margin or
guarantee for, or to secure any transaction of or to extend credit of any person other than the client; and
record and maintain a separate book entry for each client in accordance with the provisions of this Part or any rules
that may be specified under subsection (2) in relation to that client’s money or other assets.
